intro: Hebecarpa tehuacana, commonly known as the Mexican starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Caricaceae and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of yellow-orange fruits. The fruits, which are edible, have a sweet and tangy flavor similar to that of the common starfruit. The plant is often grown for its ornamental value as well as its fruit production. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
